intro: Dillandia perfoliata, commonly known as the perfoliate dillandia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves that are often fused at the base, creating a perfoliate appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Dillandia perfoliata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
